pageContext.description:
Late Middle Bronze Age or Late Bronze Age tanged knife in two fragments with much of the upper parts of the cutting edges missing. The larger piece was found in September 2011 and details were entered into the HER. The tip, recovered in March 2016, was recorded as part of Middle Bronze Age rapier. In October 2016 the finder of both demonstrated that the two were parts of the same object. The object is quite closely paralleled by examples from the Norwich Eaton I hoard (Norwich Castle Museum 1977, 33-4, fig. 70) and the Bath Monkswood hoard (Inventaria Archaeologica (1959) GB 42, nos. 20-1). Extant length and width 110.5 and 22mm. Thickness 1.7mm. Weight of tip only 5.32g. c.1100 - c.700 BC.



Field T3
